intro: Thliphthisa baldaccii, commonly known as the Sudanese thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Sudan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and spiny leaves, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thliphthisa baldaccii is notable for its resilience and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
